Sure thing! Here’s a typical (synthetic) log entry you’ll see when a floor‑price validation error occurs because the entered absolute floor price falls below the system’s minimum threshold:

```
2026‑01‑01 14:32:07,278 ERROR  [FloorPriceValidator] – Floor price validation failed.
  • Value provided: $5.00
  • Minimum allowed: $10.00
  • Error: "Floor price 5.00 is less than the required minimum threshold of 10.00."
```

This entry includes the timestamp, severity level, source module, the problematic price value, the configured minimum, and a clear error message that explains why the validation failed. Feel free to copy this format into your audit templates or tweak the currency/threshold values to match your environment.
